Detailed Description

Interrupt synchronisation handler.

Guard enables the operating system to synchroniste actions of interrupt handlers for critical sections that are secured using the lock of the Guard object.

Definition at line 21 of file guard.h.

Member Function Documentation

void Guard::leave (  ) 

leave the critical section

Waiting epilogues can be processed now.

Todo:
write implementation
void Guard::relay ( Gate *  item  ) 

try to execute epilogue

If possible the epilogue is processed right away but if the critical section used for the epilogue is locke the epilogue has to be queued for later processing.

Todo:
write implementation
Parameters:
item pointer to the Gate object implementing the epilogue.
Gate* Guard::remove_epilogue (  )  [private]

queue of waiting epilogues

Todo:
write declaration

remove a queued epilogue from the queue This method has to be called secured to ensure that the structure of the queue stays consistent.

Todo:
write implementation
Returns:
a pointer to the Gate object implementing the next epilogue, or NULL if queue is empty.
